text: Good Morning All! I was pointed this way by D C, If its the same person here as Twitter.. EXTREME Newbie to automation. Thrown together some python for very small programs, only to get them to produce the results I'm after. Starting Year 2 of a Data Science degree in September through the open uni as a side to creating my own betfair models. Never worked with an API before so as a complete beginner what Programming Fundamentals would you recommend diving into before even attempting to use bflw to automate my trading?

elements.text: Good Morning All! I was pointed this way by D C, If its the same person here as Twitter.. EXTREME Newbie to automation. Thrown together some python for very small programs, only to get them to produce the results I'm after. Starting Year 2 of a Data Science degree in September through the open uni as a side to creating my own betfair models. Never worked with an API before so as a complete beginner what Programming Fundamentals would you recommend diving into before even attempting to use bflw to automate my trading?

text: Welcome

elements.text: Welcome

text: Thanks <@UBS7QANF3>

elements.text: Thanks

text: It sounds like you are already capable of writing Python to some extent so personally I recommend you just start playing around with the bflw examples: <https://github.com/liampauling/betfair/tree/master/examples>. I think it's always best to learn by doing something related to your end goal

elements.text: It sounds like you are already capable of writing Python to some extent so personally I recommend you just start playing around with the bflw examples:
. I think it's always best to learn by doing something related to your end goal

text: makes sense <@UBS7QANF3>, ill apply for a bf API key today and make a start, apologies in advance as I'm sure there will be many more newbie questions in the future, I will obviously try google first!

elements.text: makes sense
, ill apply for a bf API key today and make a start, apologies in advance as I'm sure there will be many more newbie questions in the future, I will obviously try google first!

text: <@U0223J9067R> I doubt you'll find too much help on Google, so don't be afraid to ask here. There's a bit of an implicit assumption here that you have a basic level of competence, but with some Python experience and a year of DS behind you, you should be comfortably over that threshold.

elements.text: I doubt you'll find too much help on Google, so don't be afraid to ask here. There's a bit of an implicit assumption here that you have a basic level of competence, but with some Python experience and a year of DS behind you, you should be comfortably over that threshold.

text: Thanks <@U9JHLMZB4>. I'm by no means coming in blind, comfortable enough with the terminology and most of the math that I've read back on here since I joined. Just never worked with others code or API's before so quite a lot to learn before I'll feel comfortable.

elements.text: Thanks

. I'm by no means coming in blind, comfortable enough with the terminology and most of the math that I've read back on here since I joined. Just never worked with others code or API's before so quite a lot to learn before I'll feel comfortable.

text: Quick one, I understand that betfair dont like people playing with the API and not betting through it, is this the case when using the Delayed key or only when Live? Dont want to get banned before I start!

elements.text: Quick one, I understand that betfair dont like people playing with the API and not betting through it, is this the case when using the Delayed key or only when Live? Dont want to get banned before I start!

text: Fine to use the delayed key without betting, but it's widely considered to be useless. Standard advice is to use the live key and bet a nominal amount

elements.text: Fine to use the delayed key without betting, but it's widely considered to be useless. Standard advice is to use the live key and bet a nominal amount
